title: Vocational Technical Education Standardized Strands: Frameworks Strands 1, 4, 5 & 6
subject: CTE (2014-)

BDFFA7AC407E4AFAB3DD4C2C913F137B.description: Plan and implement a collaborative project with students in other classrooms and schools using telecommunications tools (e.g., e-mail, discussion forums, groupware, interactive Web sites, video conferencing).

29AFBF33B1104442A80C7886C7E64066.description: Use online communication tools to collaborate with peers, community members, and field experts as appropriate (e.g., bulletin boards, discussion forums, listservs, Web conferencing).

13B4FDECA138465385B2A6C5A2F71725.description: Demonstrate how the use of various techniques and effects (e.g., editing, music, color, rhetorical devices) can be used to convey meaning in media.

E61AD52439514684A4582294B911F6BF.description: Use a variety of media to present information for specific purposes (e.g., reports, research papers, presentations, newsletters, Web sites, podcasts, blogs), citing sources.

729D9DC9FED2419D91BF4A01ECD68494.description: Select the most appropriate search engines and directories for specific research tasks.

7B8D89C39F404EB5A791B0504BB62543.description: Compare, evaluate, and select appropriate electronic resources to locate specific information.

70F9F6B53DC94CE3B01AAF049B619793.description: Devise and demonstrate strategies for efficiently collecting and organizing information from electronic sources.

1D3AA3591526456B89F421838AB575B4.description: Explain and use practices to protect one's personal safety online (e.g., not sharing personal information with strangers, being alert for online predators, reporting suspicious activities).

6D3BF071519C4A67B48486FF96EC100A.description: Describe devices, applications, and operating system features that offer accessibility for people with disabilities.

4C1CB4A3FA804DF8A23E6CCA2D10BCF6.description: Evaluate the authenticity, accuracy, appropriateness, and bias of electronic resources, including Web sites.

02FA0CA9EE674B73B1EC2A6A59B1A7AB.description: Design and implement a personal learning plan that includes the use of technology to support lifelong learning goals.

BBD39B1C09B8472C878FC5E5343AC958.description: Identify examples of plagiarism, and discuss the possible consequences of plagiarizing the work of others.

9F03B626E98040198F0863A6C5B74C17.description: Explain laws restricting the use of copyrighted materials.

9B2465FA767B4AB19BE28FE2B9E8DE9C.description: Demonstrate compliance with the school’s Acceptable Use Policy.

C007643C4D7D446DA2767ED551703FB4.description: Demonstrate the responsible use of technology and an understanding of ethics and safety issues in using electronic media at home, in school, and in society.

29C8AD4FEFBF4606A04726E353DAB1E6.description: Describe good practices for password protection and authentication.

D39CED49E754442EA186CD04AE62B52D.description: Explain and demonstrate effective search strategies for locating and retrieving electronic information (e.g., using syntax and Boolean logic operators).

629466B0CCC44C2CBC27106F8ACA6BD7.description: Explain the differences among various search engines and how they rank results.

E5523929DB0A4791BDDCC01892D30A95.description: Use search engines and online directories.

B61970A4647E4013A22506BD77BB1BB2.description: Apply advanced formatting and page layout features when appropriate (e.g., columns, templates, and styles) to improve the appearance of documents and materials.

442B075983234573A4F4B0E9ADD835B9.description: Explain effective backup and recovery strategies.

6BDA912193F24DAE81730D7394D8C1BD.description: Utilize a decision-making process to make effective business decisions.

877358976F504F729186DD54F5EB9F7A.description: Compare and contrast types of business ownership (i.e., sole proprietorships, franchises, partnerships, corporations).

03AC2A3DBDBA4746AEE4131EDEE24758.description: Negotiate solutions to interpersonal and workplace conflicts.

1729B640E246436E802D25F11D721468.description: Maintain focus on tasks and avoid negative topics or excessive personal conversations in the workplace.

7AC19E18B10A46F283FE941833458500.description: Explain and follow workplace policy on the use of cell phones and other forms of social media.

4CB45F1641E94074BF4C074686062B17.description: See projects through completion and check work for quality and accuracy.

B52DE8A603D349D6938FC4F19A4D09F9.description: Implement solution(s) to challenges and/or problem(s) observed in the workplace.

8BA7179F57664D88820EE9606EFF3162.description: Demonstrate the ability to evaluate multiple solutions to problems and challenges using critical reasoning and workplace/industry knowledge and select the best solution to the problem.

4DA0CF2704024F51943D95B7E4B6C161.description: Explain proposed solutions to challenges observed in the workplace.

B27D6AFF53914F558338F6B3DE3F3302.description: Demonstrate initiative by requesting new assignments and challenges.

62FD08CC3E3146549A0FBF85B9EDB089.description: Demonstrate motivation through enthusiasm, engagement, accurate completion of tasks and activities.

9995789FF4694C82AF1238408534D349.description: Evaluate assigned tasks for time to completion and prioritization.

895518A0F39843DABBEB06D738DFB51B.description: Analyze own learning style and seek instructions in a preferred format that works best for their understanding (such as oral, written or visual instruction).

CBCF2E024BC54B9783DDEDEF5F244D71.description: Ask appropriate questions to clarify understanding of feedback.

3DEF1140FA164602B7291D71454B69AA.description: Demonstrate ability (both verbally and non-verbally) to accept direction and constructive criticism and to implement solutions to change behaviors.

7081CBE2D05F47E6BCA2A312587F89FC.description: Identify and practice personal hygiene appropriate for duties specific to the workplace.

2C43205ACD23487CBE93BD4B3A79526F.description: Identify and practice professional appearance specific to the workplace.

6AEFAAD764BB43048D6C723394A81D39.description: Identify and practice professional time-management and attendance behaviors including punctuality, reliability, planning and flexibility.

DF3ACDECC27D43FC887DB04BB87E6B19.description: Show initiative in improving communication skills by asking follow-up questions of speaker in order to confirm understanding.

BBFC90CF13A94E74AEF3F81E34E5CF07.description: Focus attentively, make eye contact or other affirming gestures, confirm understanding and follow directions.

53DF977381F64140AD43A587110E3229.description: Listen attentively and respectfully to others.

F8F1E6A496B44CC38BB41BE86275ED96.description: Identify and demonstrate professional non-verbal communication.

209EE36538BB47CCA3072D4A1521BFF3.description: Orally present technical and work-related information to a variety of audiences.

E9425E5A6AF3474BA48B9F2F3FCA858C.description: Use a variety of financial and data analysis tools to analyze and interpret information in the workplace.

99D6AFD37525485195F5304EF845FD10.description: Identify, locate, evaluate and use print and electronic resources to resolve issues or problems in the workplace.

FF4A35BCE40E4783AA448F2AAC8041BE.description: Use a variety of writing/publishing/presentation applications to create and present information in the workplace.

B5C16776DFB349419557A800386DB31B.description: Demonstrate professional writing skills in work-related materials and communications (e.g., letters, memoranda, instructions and directions, reports, summaries, notes and/or outlines).

57C885C3C48C413386031F3067A1F66D.description: Read technical and work-related documents and demonstrate understanding in oral discussion and written exercise.

0885A9EE2AEE489B986EEDFF3D26BDDE.description: Communicate effectively using the language and vocabulary appropriate to a variety of audiences within the workplace including coworkers, supervisors and customers.

E79481FC194A42829E31793879094CA9.description: Demonstrate appropriate oral and written communication skills in the workplace.

C3C8218A2A2F4FF288C911762E1E00C6.description: Explore and evaluate employment benefit packages including wages, vacation, health care, union dues, cafeteria plans, tuition reimbursement, retirement and 401K.

E7B635AB416A4BB3BC0AC9C2EB539D8B.description: Practice effective interviewing skills: appearance, inquiry and dialogue with interviewer, positive attitude and evidence of work ethic and skills.

D559060C3B654E56BD2F42523CEEC3E8.description: Identify employment eligibility criteria, such as drug/alcohol free status, clean driving record, etc.

71C692AFE39A44B2B6C4A62C47F2930A.description: Gather relevant information about potential employer(s) from multiple print and digital sources, assessing the credibility and accuracy of each source.

85B82B524BBD4741B581474232F97F44.description: Demonstrate all phases of the job interview process.

D5FDBCD5221A477F92C19FEC16CF529B.description: Demonstrate ability to use social media and networking to develop useful occupational contacts, job seeking and career development opportunities.

10A53B24969540CE95DF8AC9E7DF0942.description: Identify role and use of social media and networking for staying current with career and employment trends as well as networking, job seeking and career development opportunities.

1996C5DAFD144EACAEF1F777181A6584.description: Explore and evaluate postsecondary job opportunities and career pathways specific to career technical areas.

A19688ECC6AA40DAA9C97274CF598ED4.description: Conduct a job search and complete written and electronic job applications, resumes, cover letters and related correspondence for a chosen career path.

78E295352F0F4B81A697D2DBC6F6759E.description: Create a portfolio showcasing academic and career growth including a career plan, safety credential, resume and a competency profile demonstrating the acquisition of the knowledge and skills associated with at least two years of full-time study in the Chapter 74 program.

EDD4C618A4AB4D7286BD7C50149FA913.description: Explore and evaluate postsecondary educational opportunities including degrees and certifications available, traditional and nontraditional postsecondary pathways, technical school and apprenticeships, cost of education, financing methods including scholarships and loans and the cost of loan repayment.

354F1AE5D28542279AC29F67D3C7CD48.description: Identify training and education requirements that lead to employment in chosen field(s) and demonstrate skills related to evaluating employment opportunities.

2DAD8BB965E745F2B8ACF55673E13F0C.description: Research and evaluate a variety of careers utilizing multiple sources of information and resources to determine potential career(s) and alternatives.

C0D4695A45874D98BF4CFE0C55AE7894.description: Examine potential career field(s)/discipline(s) and identify criteria to select, secure and keep employment in chosen field(s).

11BA045BA8A04EC9883496118B3CE205.description: Assess personal strengths and interest areas to determine potential careers, career pathways and career ladders.

2B6466DB7DF741D983435C6F0A22D80D.description: Develop and revise career plan annually based on workplace awareness and skill attainment.

76DDB97F82D44EDA801D711E796EE7DB.description: Develop a career plan and portfolio.

81C8DA3943B74318B5157FD5EAEF755D.description: Demonstrate positive and appropriate behavior that contributes to a safe and healthy environment in school and the workplace.

1F9AFDCA15284D3CA7168ADC8072C80F.description: Discuss ways to identify, prevent and report school and workplace violence, discrimination, harassment and bullying.

08F1FC43279F48E69B66EC01B54D8ACC.description: Discuss the role of the individual and the company/organization in ensuring workplace safety including transportation to and from school, school activities and the workplace.

7551932971134DAD92CB52F90C4777F5.description: Identify and describe fire protection, protection, precautions and response procedures.

78C7B47E753B4547BD5FD0B93374DACA.description: Identify, describe and demonstrate safety practices in specific occupational areas used to avoid accidents.

B89CBF363EF5437D9AD5914B5ED706FF.description: Describe procedures used to handle emergency situations, defensive measures and accidents, including identification, reporting, response, evacuation plans and follow-up procedures.

6FF6F455BE344F37B1756CEE1AF6AD10.description: Describe the importance of emergency preparedness and an emergency action/response plan.

79CE1EB579AD4860A5C80B3723195272.description: Describe First Aid procedures for potential injuries and other health concerns in the specific occupational area.

5295211B50D04468A2BC9B1AE20D9516.description: Demonstrate appropriate responses to situations that may threaten health and safety.

E21E47C7A87B49F9B26D51AFA4582449.description: Demonstrate appropriate workspace cleaning, sanitation, disinfection and sterilization procedures required in specific occupational areas, e.g., Workplace Housekeeping OSHA Regulations.

388C696F400448CBBF076C97AEAB1374.description: Handle, store, dispose of and recycle hazardous, flammable and combustible materials, according to EPA, OSHA and product specifications.

7AA6F926C3A44A3C87A1E76064452098.description: Describe safety practices and procedures to be followed when working with and around electricity, e.g., ground fault circuit interrupter (GFCI) and frayed wiring.

B9AAE92A81064B47A9BEB78F46EBC646.description: Demonstrate the safe use, storage, and maintenance of every piece of equipment in the lab, shop and classroom, e.g., the OSHA Lockout/Tagout Program (LOTO).

539B5E8BFAFD4C0C96CDF071AA97C90C.description: Locate emergency equipment, first aid kit, SDS information directories and emergency action/response plan/escape routes in your lab, shop  and classroom, including labels and signage that follow OSHA Hazard Communication Program (HAZCOM), eyewash stations, shower facilities, sinks, fire extinguishers, fire blankets, telephone, master power switches and emergency exits.

4EB18AF7BD7846E3A0DF33D85C5783F5.description: Demonstrate appropriate safe body mechanics, including appropriate lifting techniques and ergonomics.

32CB6133F32B4C25A7F1A7A3D50ED3DB.description: Demonstrate safe dress and use of relevant safety gear, personal protective equipment (PPE) and ergonomics, e.g., wrist rests, adjustable workspaces, equipment, gloves, proper footwear, earplugs, eye protection and breathing apparatus.

ADAD102FC5A54318BE5CF3ED7C0E3A8C.description: Identify, describe and demonstrate personal, shop and job site safety practices and procedures.

168D8A644A4440DDBB14250892BB4702.description: Read and interpret chemical, product and equipment labels to determine appropriate health and safety considerations.

F167381307EA43019A75595B2C873FC3.description: Identify, describe and demonstrate the effective use of Safety Data Sheets (SDS).

1CAAE68A890540C5815A995535D1E3F9.description: Demonstrate appropriate health and safety practices based on the specific occupational area.

5496820A2AE346C69E5F2C4C57C3E2FC.description: Identify and list contact information for appropriate health and safety agencies and resources.

57BBEA5808834F4A84EB7C2A2F426380.description: Identify and describe potential consequences for non-compliance with appropriate health and safety regulations.

C5D29E07FEE847D7A20BEB38721B1BEA.description: Explain procedures for documenting and reporting hazards to appropriate authorities.

A0F05771AE6246249FDD03CFFD9AB7A2.description: Identify, describe and apply Right-To-Know (Hazard Communication Policy) and other communicative regulations that apply to specific tasks and jobs in the specific occupational area.

3902223342EB4F1EA9D95D910DDDC785.description: Identify, describe and apply Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) and other environmental protection regulations that apply to specific tasks and jobs in the specific occupational area.

403A8EBFEA224C32B14388B101E8862D.description: Identify, describe and apply health and safety regulations that apply to specific tasks and jobs. Students must complete a safety credential program, e.g., Occupational Safety and Health Administration 10, CareerSafe and ServSafe.

BBBEF9A321524F918AD99A6CA6F24AD8.description: Describe and apply health and safety regulations.
